xxl.core.io

Interface Convertable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Point, Rectangle, Strategy, TIdManager
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPoint, AbstractStrategy, AppendOnlyNStrategy, AppendOnlyStrategy, BestFitOnNEmptiestPagesStrategy, BestFitStrategy, BitSet, BlockBasedQueue, DecoratorTesterStrategy, DistanceWeightedKPE, DoublePoint, DoublePointRectangle, FirstFitStrategy, FixedPoint, FixedPointRectangle, FloatPoint, FloatPointRectangle, HybridAONFStrategy, HybridBFOEStrategy, HybridStrategy, IdentityTIdManager, KPE, KPEzCode, LastToFirstFitStrategy, LongIdGenerator, LRUStrategy, MapTIdManager, MinSkewHist.Bucket, NextFitStrategy, NextFitWithHStrategy, NextFitWithHWStrategy, NumberPoint, OneRecordPerPageStrategy, Page, RecordManager, SpatialHistogramBucket, Sphere

    public interface Convertable
extends Serializable
    The interface Convertable is a replacement for the SDK Externalizable interface because of its drawbacks. The SDK serialization mechanism has two serious drawbacks:
    • it causes overhead by writing additional data like the identity of class to the output stream.
    • it does not accept raw data input streams because it expects the written additional data.

    The write and read methods of the Convertable interface are implemented by a class to give the class complete control over the format and contents of the stream for an object and its supertypes. These methods must explicitly coordinate with the supertype to save its state.
    See Also:
    DataInput, DataOutput, IOException

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void read(DataInput dataInput)
      Reads the state (the attributes) for an object of this class from the specified data input and restores the calling object.
      void write(DataOutput dataOutput)
      Writes the state (the attributes) of the calling object to the specified data output.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        void read(DataInput dataInput)
   throws IOException
        Reads the state (the attributes) for an object of this class from the specified data input and restores the calling object. The state of the object before calling read will be lost.
        The read method must read the values in the same sequence and with the same types as were written by write.
        Parameters:
        dataInput - the stream to read data from in order to restore the object.
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O errors occur.

      • write

        void write(DataOutput dataOutput)
    throws IOException
        Writes the state (the attributes) of the calling object to the specified data output. This method should serialize the state of this object without calling another write method in order to prevent recursions.
        Parameters:
        dataOutput - the stream to write the state (the attributes) of the object to.
        Throws:
        IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.
